intro: Thesium hararensis, commonly known as the Harare thesium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its succulent, evergreen leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Thesium hararensis is often found in open grasslands and is a hardy species that can withstand drought conditions.
